bibl.title: Note from Dorma V. Schnurr to [Philip Showalter Hench], September 27, 1944

div1.p: Schnurr informs [Hench] that Moran is unable to identify the persons in the photograph.

div1.head: Note from Dorma V. Schnurr to [Philip Showalter Hench], September 27, 1944
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
September 27, 1944
Y
3/9/48 Moran now recognizes
#2 as Cooke #4 as Kissinger in chevrons
-15
#8 springer
****************
Hence photo taken after about Jan 10, 1901
Also agrees it was at Camp Lazear
div1.p:
Mr. Moran asked me to report to you that he couldn't identify,
even with a reading glass, any of the persons in the photograph. He
does not think it is Dr. Cooke because of the type of uniform the man
in the picture wears. It is his opinion that is was taken somewhere
other than Camp Lazear. He will write you in detail when he returns to
Cuba. Mr. and Mrs. Moran are certainly charming people and I enjoyed
meeting them. Mr. Moran was very lavish of his praises of the Hench
family and was most appreciative of all the things you did to make their
stay here pleasant and profitable. He was most impressed. Did Mrs. Hench
send you the very nice article about him which appeared in the Post-
Bulletin or do you get the paper?
